name: Avian Brains - Early Tutorial Prototype
description:
Avian Brains is a Web GL project designed to help teach players about the anatomical visual pathway through exploration of a Flycatcher's brain and relevant visual anatomy such as the eyeball, diagnosis of degenerative diseases within the visual pathway, and puzzles that teach players how the eye of a bird functions and how it differs from that of humans. It was done through the University of Arkansas at my current employer, The Tesseract Center for Immersive Environment and Game Design: http://tesseract.uark.edu/

  • Mouse Move - Camera
  • WASD - Rotate Player
  • Right Click(Hold) - Accelerate
  • T Key(Press) - Quick Turn
  • Left Click(Hold) - Aim
  • Left Click(Release over Target) - Use Current Tool
  • Middle Mouse(Press) - Reset Current Tool
  • Middle Mouse(Hold) - Reset All Tools
  • R Key(Hold) - Open Tool Radial Menu
  • R Key(Release) - Set Current Tool to Radial Selection
  • E Key(Press) - Reset Camera
